    Constructor method copies another Fraction object using getNum & getDenom methods ALSO uses Constructor Method (not even a question at this points)
    Fraction(String s)
    Constructor takes string with "/" inbetween two single digits ints, which serve as numerator and denominator You guessed it, this constructor ALSO runs Constructor Method The issue with this method is that if a fraction object is created with a two digit integer on either side, it breaks.

  • Constructor Details

    • Fraction

      public Fraction()

    • Fraction

      public Fraction(int n, int d)
      Constructor with two ints as inputs runs Constructor Method

    • Fraction

      public Fraction(String s)
      Constructor takes string with "/" inbetween two single digits ints, which serve as numerator and denominator You guessed it, this constructor ALSO runs Constructor Method The issue with this method is that if a fraction object is created with a two digit integer on either side, it breaks. Two possible fixes are assuming the user only inputs numbers like "26/33", or scanning through the string to see when the digits stop. One is more simple, but less error-proof, and the other takes more processing to do.

    • Fraction

      public Fraction(Fraction f)
      Constructor method copies another Fraction object using getNum & getDenom methods ALSO uses Constructor Method (not even a question at this points)
